alert.note: Alert for Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued October 11 at 2:02AM MDT until October 13 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOWFALL POTENTIAL INCREASING FOR THE BLACK HILLS THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY... .A potent storm system will bring heavy precipitation and strong winds to the region today through Friday. Precipitation will begin as rain today, with some thunderstorms possible this afternoon and tonight. Colder air wrapping into the system will allow precipitation to change over to snow across the Black Hills late tonight into tomorrow morning. Accumulating snow is likely over much of the Black Hills tomorrow through Friday morning, particularly across higher elevations of the northern and central hills. Confidence in precipitation types decreases at elevations below 4000 feet. However, precipitation will mix with or change over to snow tomorrow into tomorrow night, particularly within areas of locally heavier precipitation over the higher foothills. In these locations, if snow can persist for enough time, several inches of snow accumulation are possible. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches, with locally higher amounts possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...In South Dakota, the Northern Black Hills and the Central Black Hills. In Wyoming, the Wyoming Black Hills. * WHEN...From Thursday morning through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch means heavy snow, strong winds, freezing precipitation, and cold temperatures are possible. Monitor NOAA weather radio, local radio or television, or the Internet for updates on this potentially dangerous storm. Take time to prepare for severe winter conditions before the storm develops.

area.areaDesc: Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills
